reviews.text: Loved this place, really good traditional food, the presa ib√©rica was amazing and the fried anchovies. I wouldn‚Äôt call this a tourist trap at all. Great service and lovely, relaxed location!
Friendly service and good food. We had croquetas, an artichoke dish, and a breaded and fried fish (cazon) and zucchini dish, all excellent.

Ok I see comments about it being a tourist trap, maybe as it‚Äôs a busy thoroughfare and close to Real Alc√°zar, i had 2 glasses of Rioja for ‚Ç¨12 ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è‚Ä¶try to get sitting outside the bar window it‚Äôs a great spot to just drink and people watch imo!

This place is a tourist trap and ripped us off. We had some great food in Seville but this was by far the worst experience we had. We ordered the large prawns for a treat but he bought out 2 plates claiming he thought we wanted 2 portions as we had pointed to a table of 6 people to say we wanted the same as on that table. He bought us 2 large plates for 2 people. We asked why we would order so much he just said it wasn‚Äôt his fault. The prawns were Luke warm and unpleasant to eat and we felt a bit sick after eating g them. The rest of the food was ok but over priced. The worst thing was the appalling attitude of the waiter. He basically ripped us off and was rude to other tourists also. Please avoid and go to place next door, it was far better.

Traditional Spanish place in the heart of the old town. Good food and good vibes all around.
Try the fish and the seafood, fresh, extremely well cooked and tasty.
The place is not pricy at all and the inside is as beautiful as the outside sitting if you happen to go on a rainy day in Sevilla (quite unlikely though)
